Reviews.Title: “My Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1966Doctor1234
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Paris and I had booked through Trip Advisor. I had my doubts and was sceptic about the place. Woah! to my pleasant surprise, the hotel was easily approachable by tube and bus. Excellent front office staff who understood and spoke English(I didnt know any French). They made feel at home. There were whole lots of restuarants to my liking and it was accesible to the main tourist destinations easily. Very calm place with perfect ambience. I have decided that if one is a budget traveller and want to be in a safe place -- THIS IS IT. keept it up !!!

Reviews.Title: “A good two-star”
Reviews.Author: GraysonDublin
Reviews.Content: A good two-star hotel with helpful staff. Room was a little cramped but clean and well-kept. Continental breakfast with optional slices of pig-meat. Only French channels on TV. Between 3 Metro stations on different lines.

Reviews.Title: “clean, simple place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trampsauce
Reviews.Content: nice little boutique hotel, in a quiet safe area of Montparnasse. metro is 5 minutes away walking. polite and helpful staff. rooms are clean, beds are comfortable Wifi is free no english tv. breakfast is poor (bread, deli meat, bad coffee). It's what I would expect for a free continental at a north american hotel. We ate it a couple times because it was included in our package, but generally ventured nearby for good coffee and fresh choices.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: jellyfishkitten
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Gaite metro station and within walking distance of the Boulevard Montparnasse where there are lots of restaurants and cafes. They hotel room and bathroom were a decent size and the bed was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good too - bread, pastries, yoghurt, tea coffee, juice, etc. Criticism? The lift was very slow so we had to use the stairs a few times (although thankfully not with our luggage!) and the hairdryer in the bathroom wasn't much use. Overall it was a great budget choice and I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for $$$ (€€€)!!”
Reviews.Author: Kerri162
Reviews.Content: Highly reccommend. Great deal in Paris, convenient access to multiple train stations, clean, comfortable room, friendly, helpful staff. No English channels on TV, but I wasn't in my room much, and having French TV was great for getting more accustomed to French!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean and Comfortable - 4.5 out of 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Vayne
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Transcontinental. This place is about a 7 minute walk to the Metro station and about 5-7 metro stops to the tourist areas. With that being said, the hotel is very well priced for Paris and is very clean and comfortable. We opted not to have the breakfast package there as we never woke up earlier than 10am and it's Paris... there are cafes at every corner! I highly recommend learning the Metro system as it truly is the easiest and most affordable way to get around Paris. Get the day passes and you're set. Cheers, V & K

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MilicaO
Reviews.Content: The cute little hotel has a boutique feel about it, from the moment you arrive to check in and are greeted by the friendly receptionist. I was not expecting all this from a two-star B&B! Our room was spotless, with a flat-screen plasma TV, a balcony with a superb view of Paris (from the 6th floor), a large bathroom and extra comfy bed. Breakfast is typically French with a choice of pastries, hams, and cheeses plus coffee/ tea/ juice. Such good value for money! A short ten-minute walk from the Bienvenue Montparnasse metro/ rail station and an even shorter five-minute walk from Gaiete metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dashuccia
Reviews.Content: Neat room, friendly staff, tasty breakfast. Location is also nice - less than 10 min walk from metro, avenue du Maine is a quiet nice street with some restaurants and brasseries. I think it might be very difficult to find something better for such a small money.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in PARIS, Hotel was a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: OLGABB091909
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 5 days on our honeymoon in Paris. I stayed at Transcontitental. Everything was great! The rooms were cleaned daily. They even put flowers for us knowing we were on a honeymoon. Concierze services were amazing: professional, fluent english, nice, friendly, and very-very helpful. The only trick was a breakfast, which is not included in your price. So, make sure you are aware of 9.50euro per a person. Also, for those who travels from States....remember you are in Europe, real state is expensive, lol. Thus, rooms are smaller then you can expect. Great choice! Great price! Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Manager”
Reviews.Author: hstkensington
Reviews.Content: Paris has a good transport system, so if you don’t mind travelling to the centre from the location of this hotel, then you’ve found your self a good hotel. The hotel is located in the district of Montparnasse. The hotel is very clean only recently renovated. The breakfast was good and the manager was very helpful. My Agent forgot to confirm my booking with the hotel, the manager seeing that I was a single female traveller went out of his way to try and find me a room in the hotel. Also not to forget, the room rate at this hotel is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a two-star hotel in a residential neighborhood, this hotel is a fantastic deal. The hotel is between two metro stops, Gaite (4 blocks north) and Alesia (4 blocks south), with Denfert-Rochereau around the corner (3-4 blocks east). Booked through Hotelclub, our reservation was immediately found and acknowledged. The staff was very polite and accomodating; they even lent us a cork screw one evening! The rooms are adequately furnished and very clean, with a window on major street (quiet at night), and adjustable heating. Very similar to staying in a city club sleeping room. We had a group of 4 women, staying in single rooms, and everyone was delighted with their room. Bathrooms were small, but NEW - the size you'd find in a single room in a hospital (and just as clean!). Great water pressure and towels changed every day, too. Breakfast available 6AM-10AM, with plenty of cafes in the immediate area. Traditional french breakfast, with ham/yougurts, etc. on self-service buffet. Cute restaurant just south. We had the reception desk call a cab one evening, and it arrived in less than 5 minutes! There is an automated system to call cabs from the desk. All in all, I would book this hotel again without the slightest hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Price”
Reviews.Author: HardLite
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights at the Transcontinental.Even though the rooms were small (But again,this is Paris), the hotel was impeccably clean.The Russian young ladies who cleaned the rooms and served breakfast were always accommodating and obliging.The reception staff was helpful.All in all for 67 Euros a night booked through hotelclub, it wasn't a bad choice at all.The previous reviewer complained about the metro station being a 7 minute walk.Is that a far distance to walk for a metro?NO.In London you can walk maybe 20 minutes to find a subway station! The bathrooms and rooms were above average for a 2 star hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Abotel Transcontinental
HotelInfo.Address: 155, avenue Du Maine | 14th Arr., 75014 Paris, France
